title.narrative: 01-3 SERVICE DELIVERY Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH)

description.narrative: Duty bearers National and Sub national levels have strengthened capacity to deliver and monitor high-impact Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) health and nutrition interventions, which contributes to Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, children, mothers and pregnant women have equitable access to high impact interventions contributing to the attainment of MDG targets for child and maternal survival and development

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION WESTERN PROVINCE

Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Duty bearers National and Sub national levels have strengthened capacity to deliver and monitor high-impact MNCH health andnutrition interventions
3. Percentage of health facilities in target districts with active CHWs trained in iCCM
2. Percentage of health facilities in target districts with health workers trained in IMNCI
1. Percentage of maternity units in target districts with staff trained(or practice) in essential newborn care
5. Antenatal care coverage (at least four visits)
4. iCCM operations study in two districts completed
6. Post Introductory Evaluations for PCV, MSD and Rotavirus vaccines conducted by 2nd Q 2014
